note.p: Birth: Butterwick House, Hammersmith, London, England (13 June 1732)
Education: Westminster School (1739) (King's Scholar); Trinity College, Cambridge. BA (1756); MA (1759)

Career: Fellow of Trinity College (1757); called to the Bar at Lincoln's Inn (1756); Recorder of Basingstoke (1766); Counsel for the HEIC (1772); First Chief Justice of Calcutta (1773 until his resignation in 1789); MP for New Romsey (1790-1796)
Notes: Note on certificate: 'Ballotted for and rejected June 4th 1795'
References: R W Home, 'The Royal Society and the Empire: the colonial and Commonwealth Fellowship. Part 1. 1731-1847' in NR 2002 vol 56 pp 307-332
